summary: Resolved conflicts in 4 files: .claude-output.json, src/types.ts, public/data/starbucks.json, public/data/costa.json. Used origin/main as the canonical base for all files — it contains a more carefully curated dataset (consistent 185mg caffeine for Costa espresso-based drinks, proper menu naming conventions, no duplicate IDs) and a more complete implementation description (includes the useDrinks hook). Retained completedTasks field from HEAD in .claude-output.json.
strategyUsed: src/types.ts: chose origin/main — adds JSDoc section comments, renames Nutrition to DrinkNutrition (matching the hook imports), makes image optional; .claude-output.json: merged — used origin/main prTitle/prBody/filesChanged (reflects full implementation with useDrinks hook), kept HEAD's completedTasks:[1,2]; public/data/starbucks.json: chose origin/main — consistent naming (Caffè Latte/Mocha/Americano), proper IDs (sbux-latte vs sbux-caffe-latte), 32 well-curated drinks across all 5 categories, no duplicate entries; public/data/costa.json: chose origin/main — consistent 185mg caffeine for espresso-based drinks, accurate menu names (Latte/Mocha instead of Caffe Latte/Caffe Mocha), 31 drinks across all 5 categories, single clean espresso entry (HEAD had duplicate IDs for espresso)
